definition[0]: the right to stay permanently in a teaching job
example[0]: It’s becoming increasingly difficult to acquire academic tenure.
definition[1]: the period of time when someone has an important job
example[1]: The company has doubled in value during his tenure.
definition[2]: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land for a period of time
definition[3]: the period of time when someone has an important job or position
example[2]: During his four-year tenure as president, the firm’s annual revenue rose dramatically.
definition[4]: the right to stay permanently in a job, for example a teaching job in a university
example[3]: the life tenure of judges at the State Courts
definition[5]: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land
